headline: Should You Invest in Sandisk Stock Post Its Q2 Earnings Release?

headline: SanDisk and Seagate: Analysts Bang the Drum on the Hottest Tech Stocks Today
summary: There’s a full month of 2026 behind us now, so it’s getting time to start talking about trends for the year. In the tech sector, one thing is clear: worries about an AI bubble are persisting, and it’s putting pressure on the industry’s hyperscalers. Those giants – think Microsoft and Nvidia here – are feeling the headwinds of high valuations and industry saturation. But at the same time, demand for memory, particularly high-end data storage, is booming. AI simply can’t function without a solid d

headline: Heard on the Street Wednesday Recap: Tech Tantrum
summary: Tech stocks continued their selloff. Tuesday’s software rout spread Wednesday to AI-enabling stocks that had rallied a lot this year. The biggest loser in the Nasdaq-100 was chip maker Advanced Micro Devices, which fell 17% after reporting worse-than-expected results.

headline: Seagate CEO Share Sale Prompts Fresh Look At AI Storage Valuation
summary: Seagate Technology Holdings (NasdaqGS:STX) CEO executed a significant insider share sale on 2 February 2026. The transaction followed strong recent operational performance and fresh quarterly results from the company. The sale comes as enthusiasm around AI linked demand for Seagate nearline and HAMR drives remains elevated. Insider selling by a CEO often draws attention from shareholders and potential investors who track management actions closely. Seagate is a major player in hard disk...
